title: Welsh language and air quality: Suggestions to help 'measure Wales'
text:
Proposed plans to help measure the well-being and progress of Wales have been revealed.
Suggestions by the Welsh Government, now out for consultation, outlines how 40 national indicators will help them analyse progress of the nation.
Credit: PA The areas include health, environment, education and the economy.
The proposed indicators would be used to publish an annual report to show what progress Wales has made. They include life expectancy, skills and qualifications, housing quality, the use of the Welsh language and air quality.
Today we are launching a major consultation to get people's views on what our national indicators should be. To put it simply, how do we, as a government measure a nation.
"This is a fantastic opportunity for public bodies, individuals and organisations to have their say on how we continue to develop and build the Wales we want.
